lines.content: Caifan is a simple command-line task manager that helps you keep track of your todos, deadlines, and events.
Adds a task with a specific deadline.
The user will expect that the task that they have input as a Deadline Task will be displayed as such:
added this for you my love <3:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.

* @param input The user input to parse
* @throws InvalidDescriptionException if the command description is invalid
public static Command parseCommand(String input) throws InvalidDescriptionException {
* Handles file operations for saving and loading tasks.

* @param taskList The list to load tasks into
* Converts a task object to its string representation for storage.
* Saves the current task list to file.
* @param taskList The task list to save
* Creates the necessary directory and file for storage if they don't exist.
* Handles all task list operations and management of tasks.
private static ArrayList<Task> taskList = new ArrayList<>();

* @param input User input containing the index to mark

* Handles all user interface operations including input and output.
* This class manages the display of messages and reading user commands.
private static Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
* Prints a string message with a newline.
* @param string The message to be printed
* Prints a divider line for visual separation.
* Displays the welcome message when the application starts.
String welcomePhrase = "\tHello! I'm Caifan!\n" + "\tWhat can I do for you?";
* Displays the goodbye message when the application exits.
String goodbyePhrase = "\tBye byeee!! Hope to see you again soon <3";
* Displays an error message when index is out of bounds.
println("\tOh no!! Please enter a valid number >_<");
* Displays an error message when an invalid task number is provided.
println("\tAre you sure you gave me a number?! T_T");
println("\tPlease try again! With a number this time >_>");
* Displays an error message for invalid commands.
println("\tHARH?! I do not understand what is that!!");
println("\tPlease provide something that my smol brain can comprehend >_<");
* Displays all tasks in the current task list.
* Displays confirmation message after adding a new task.
* @param task The task that was added
println("\tadded this for you my love <3:");
println("\tNow you have " + taskList.getSize() + " tasks in the list.");
* Displays confirmation message after deleting a task.
* @param removedTask The task that was removed
println("\tNow you have " + taskList.getSize() + " tasks in the list.");
* Displays confirmation message after marking a task as done.
* @param index The index of the task that was marked as done
* Reads the next line of input from the user.
* @return The command string entered by the user
* Represents a command to add a new task to the task list.
* This command handles the creation and addition of all task types (Todo, Deadline, Event).
* Creates a new add command with the specified command string and task.
* @param command The original command string from user input
* @param task The task object to be added to the task list
* Executes the add command by adding the task to the task list.
* The task list will be updated and the task will be persisted.
* Abstract base class for all commands.
* Creates a new command with the given input string.
* Executes the command according to which command class is called
* Returns a string representation of the todo task.
* Includes the task type, completion status, and description.
* @return The formatted string representation of the todo task
* Creates a new deadline command with the specified task.
* @param command The original command string from user input
* Executes the deadline command by adding the deadline task to the task list.
* The task list will be updated and the task will be persisted.
Ui.println("\tWhy is your description/deadline empty?!! Put something there >_<");
Ui.println("\tPlease input a valid deadline or description, HMPH :<");
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* This command removes the specified task based on its index.
* @param command The original command string containing the index to delete
* Executes the delete command by removing the specified task from the list.
* The task list will be updated and changes will be persisted.
* Executes the deadline command by adding the deadline task to the task list.
* The task list will be updated and the task will be persisted.
* Creates a new event command with the specified task.
* @param command The original command string from user input
* Executes the event command by adding the event task to the task list.
* The task list will be updated and the task will be persisted.
Ui.println("\tWhy is your description or start/end dates empty?!! Put something there >_<");
Ui.println("\tPlease input a valid event or start/end dates, HMPH :<");
* Represents a command to exit the application.
* This command triggers the shutdown of the program.
* Represents a command to exit the application.
* This command triggers the shutdown of the program.
* No specific action needed as the main loop checks isExit().
* Indicates that this command should terminate the program.
* @return true to signal that the program should exit
* Command to find tasks matching a keyword.
* Executes the find command to search for tasks.
* Represents a command to display all tasks in the task list.
* This command shows the complete list of tasks with their current status.
* @param command The original command string from user input
* Executes the list command by displaying all tasks in the task list.
* Executes the delete command by removing the specified task from the list.
* The task list will be updated and changes will be persisted.
* @param command The original command string containing the index to mark as done
* Executes the done command by marking the specified task as completed.
* The task list will be updated and changes will be persisted.
* Represents a command to create and add a new todo task.
* This command handles parsing todo task details and adding them to the task list.
* Creates a new todo command with the specified task.
* @param command The original command string from user input
* Executes the todo command by adding the todo task to the task list.
* The task list will be updated and the task will be persisted.

* Represents a command to mark a task as not completed.
* This command reverses the completion status of the specified task.
* @param command The original command string containing the index to unmark
* Executes the unmark command by marking the specified task as not completed.
* The task list will be updated and changes will be persisted.
* Exception thrown when a task description is invalid.
* Represents a task with a deadline.

* @param description The description of the task

* Gets the type of the task.
* @return The type of the task ("D" for deadline)
* Gets the deadline of the task.
* Returns the string representation of the task.
* @return The string representation of the task
* Represents a task that has a start and end time/date.
* This class extends Task to include event-specific timing information.
* Creates a new event task with the specified description and timing.
* @param description The description of the event
* @param start The start time/date of the event
* @param end The end time/date of the event
public Event (String description, String start, String end) {
